name: Killing Me Just a Little Harder
description: Swapped quite a few cards from the original build. Gone are the 3xForged Activation Orders, 2xDinosaurus, 2xKati Jones, 1xProfessional Contact, and 2xAtman. With Dagger as my main breaker, I saw myself just running rather than burning time on Forge Activation Orders. MU was often a problem and hoping to get Dinosaurus set up too long for the aggressive deck. The Mem Chips and Spinal Modem fixed that easily. Atmans for Gordian and Snowball were no brainers. Make the backup breakers useful for a lot of things rather than just a few cards. And turn off Wraparound. Economy was also an issue in the original, as Paintbrush was so click intensive and I never had time for Kati Jones. You need drip or burst economy for this deck, so in came three Daily Casts and one Lucky Find. I'm still messing with this idea and I have a second direction using Toolbox, Rabbithole, Underworld contacts, and a few other small changes.

name: Haas's Digital Fortress v7 (4-0 Ench. Grounds Championship)
description:
I've been tinkering with this deck for quite a long time. It's quite fun to play and pretty straightforward:

All the ice is econ drain/taxing (even Bastion, since it takes most everyone 3 bucks to get through it). All the assets are expensive to trash. Drop and protect a Haas early and ride her to the end. The one Biotic was the key to this version. Gets you over that hump if you fall a bit behind.

About the only thing I'd tweak after today's matches was that Private Contracts wasn't really needed.

name: Yellow Counterstrike
description:
The idea is simple: pile up credits and combo pieces until you can flatline your opponent. The catch is that, at most, you get 2 chances to counterstrike.

Possible scenarios: 1) He is screwed -- easy and unlikely one: the runner has no carapace/crash space and just stole one of your agendas. Kill him/her/it with 2 PC (either draw them or Power Shutdown + Accelerated Diagnostics).

2) Fingers crossed/touch wood (or other things): the runner has 1 carapace that you didn't manage to peel off. 3 PC if he has less than 5 cards. Otherwise, if he hasn't scored an agenda yet, you'll have to lure him/her into stealing 2 agendas in the same turn. Snoop and IoP might help you out.

3) Oh, I'm screwed -- you should have been faster my friend: the runner has 2+ carapace. Do the 2 agendas trick, if you can. Otherwise gather your cards, shake opponent's hand and say goodbye.

ICE configuration:

Obviously you have to save credits for PC. Cheap ICE therefore is good and that's why you have plenty. Data Hound helps you getting rid of carapaces and delaying them a bit. Snoop is good but expensive, so you get only one. Use it well.

name: Paint the door open!
description: With Kit, you're pretty much certain that you can get in the early turns. Hence the Account Siphons to set up your economy, pay for your R&D Interfaces and get rolling.

name: Cant Wait to play this ! UPDATE
description:
This deck will be so damn FUN

Mushin no shin + Plan B = Easy score

Comment if you like.

name: Armored Gopher Season 1 Gameday - 1st Place Runner - 2014/4/
description:
Based on my Store Championship deck: http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/3425/realms-of-gaming-troy-il-store-champion-runner-3-22-2

In the last tournament I played in I noticed I did not use Mr. Li all day and rarely used Kati Jones so I removed them, and decided to shift my focus to early game. The influence went from 2x R&D Interface, 2x Déjà Vu and Corroder to 1x Indexing, 1x Parasite and 1x Knight.

name: Armored Gopher Season 1 Gameday - 1st Place Corp - 2014/4/19
description:
I was still worried about Blackmail, so I went with the same Supermodernism that I used for the Realms of Gaming Store Championship deck I last month. Besides Jackson Howard x3 instead of Anon Tip, the only major chance was an Aggressive Secretary instead of GLC. I usually have a Tollbooth, but I was so afraid of Blackmail that I decided to include an Aggressive Secretary.

Based on the original Supermodernism: http://boardgamegeek.com/article/14619703#14619703

name: NBN - Broadcast Square Shenanigans
description:
Here's my attempt at a broadcast square deck. With NBN's ability, the illicit ice trace subroutines suddenly become either very taxing or very punishing, and a grim in front of shinobi can be deadly. This deck is built to be heavily taxing with ASH, illicit ice, and high cost to trash assets, as well as a mix of tag punishment with market research, PSF, and closed accounts. Adonis campaign and private contracts are there to provide a bit more lasting econ to rez expensive ice, I'm still worried about econ in general though.

I'd love to hear some suggestions.

name: Getting in to your servers like it aint yo bizniz 1.1
April 2014 Labyrinth Draft Tournament
description: Went 5-3 in the tournament, with 2 wins as Corp, 3 wins as Runner.

name: April 2014 Labyrinth Draft Tournament
description: Went 5 and 3, with 2 wins as Corp and 3 wins as Runner

name: Draft 1st Runner, Hidden Lair, Mt. Zion, IL- 2014/04/12
description:
Went 3-0.

For the runner I decided to go simple, and I ended up with a less than optimal breaker suite - 3x Femme, 1x Aurora, and 1x Battering Ram. Not feeling confident about this I went ahead and included 2x Crypsis from the starter. I was lucky and drafted a Test Run early, and tutoring Femmes are great to surprise and for one turn at least make really expensive ICE cheap to bypass. I did not have much luck on drafting econ so I was concerned about economy. I ended up using 1x Sure Gamble, 3x Compromised Employee and used 2x Armitiage from the starter.

About halfway through the first game I realized I had not drafted enough ice breakers and was having a hard time finding them. I found myself using the Test Run/Femme to get through remotes and steal all the time.

More details: http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/1156297/1st-place-netrunner-draft-the-hidden-lair-mt-zi

name: Draft 1st Corp, Hidden Lair, Mt. Zion, IL- 2014/04/12
description:
Went 2-1 with corp deck.

Since this was my first draft I decided to take it simple. I drafted a variety of ICE, a few agendas and some econ. I only saw big barriers so I got a Wall of Thorns, Hadrian’s Wall and Heimdall 1.0. The rest were a variety of small but cheap ICE – Viktor 1.0, Wall of Static, Draco, etc. I did not see one Hedge Fund, but I got a Mélange Mining Corp, 2x Adonis and 2x Eve. Mélange was an all-star for the night.

More details: http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/1156297/1st-place-netrunner-draft-the-hidden-lair-mt-zi
